Title: (Mandrake Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlhotcopy' Unsafe Temporary Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysqlhotcopy.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
The vendor reported that mysqlhotcopy creates temporary files in '/tmp' using predictable file names.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to a predicted temporary filename.  Then, when mysqlhotcopy is run, the symlinked file may be overwritten.

Jeroen van Wolffelaar is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
Mandrake has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlbug' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the 'mysqlbug' component.  A local user can overwrite files on the target system.
Shaun Colley reported that when a user runs 'mysqlbug' and then exits the text editor without modifying the bug report, a temporary file ('/tmp/failed-mysql-bugreport') is created in an unsafe manner.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file.  Then, when the error condition is triggered by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqld_multi' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the MySQL 'mysqld_multi' script.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
SuSE reported that the 'mysqld_multi' shell script creates a temporary log file ('/tmp/mysqld_multi.log') in an unsafe manner. A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file. Then, when the script is run by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user. A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlhotcopy' Unsafe Temporary Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysqlhotcopy.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
The vendor reported that mysqlhotcopy creates temporary files in '/tmp' using predictable file names.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to a predicted temporary filename.  Then, when mysqlhotcopy is run, the symlinked file may be overwritten.

Jeroen van Wolffelaar is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL May Let Remote Authenticated Users Access Restricted Tables or Crash the System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in MySQL.  A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.  A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
In March 2004, Oleksandr Byelkin reported that an 'alter table [...] rename [...]' command will check the create/insert rights of the old table instead of the new table [CVE: CVE-2004-0835].  As a result, a user may be able to gain access to tables that the user is not authorized to access.

In January 2004, Dean Ellis reported that if multiple threads issue 'alter' commands against 'merge' tables to modify the 'union', the target server may crash [CVE: CVE-2004-0837].

The original bug reports are available at:

http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=3270
http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=2408
Impact':
A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.

A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL Buffer Overflow in mysql_real_connect() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysql_real_connect().  A remote user with control over DNS may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.
Lukasz Wojtow reported that the software does not validate the length of user-supplied input (supplied by a DNS server) to determine if the host address will fit within the 'sock_addr.sin_addr' buffer when a reverse DNS lookup is performed.  A remote user with control over the DNS or the ability to spoof the DNS may be able to supply a specially crafted return value to trigger the buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL Access Control Error in Databases With Underscore Wildcard Character May Grant Unauthorized Access
Description:
An access control vulnerability was reported in MySQL.  A remote authenticated user can gain unauthorized privileges on a database.
Sergei Golubchik reported that a remote authenticated user can gain privileges on a database if the user is granted privileges on a similarly named database that contains an underscore in the database name.  For example, a user with privileges on 'some_db' can gain privileges on 'some1db', 'some2db', and similarly named databases.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain unauthorized privileges on an arbitrary database.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlbug' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the 'mysqlbug' component.  A local user can overwrite files on the target system.
Shaun Colley reported that when a user runs 'mysqlbug' and then exits the text editor without modifying the bug report, a temporary file ('/tmp/failed-mysql-bugreport') is created in an unsafe manner.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file.  Then, when the error condition is triggered by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqld_multi' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the MySQL 'mysqld_multi' script.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
SuSE reported that the 'mysqld_multi' shell script creates a temporary log file ('/tmp/mysqld_multi.log') in an unsafe manner. A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file. Then, when the script is run by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user. A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlhotcopy' Unsafe Temporary Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysqlhotcopy.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
The vendor reported that mysqlhotcopy creates temporary files in '/tmp' using predictable file names.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to a predicted temporary filename.  Then, when mysqlhotcopy is run, the symlinked file may be overwritten.

Jeroen van Wolffelaar is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL May Let Remote Authenticated Users Access Restricted Tables or Crash the System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in MySQL.  A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.  A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
In March 2004, Oleksandr Byelkin reported that an 'alter table [...] rename [...]' command will check the create/insert rights of the old table instead of the new table [CVE: CVE-2004-0835].  As a result, a user may be able to gain access to tables that the user is not authorized to access.

In January 2004, Dean Ellis reported that if multiple threads issue 'alter' commands against 'merge' tables to modify the 'union', the target server may crash [CVE: CVE-2004-0837].

The original bug reports are available at:

http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=3270
http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=2408
Impact':
A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.

A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL Buffer Overflow in mysql_real_connect() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysql_real_connect().  A remote user with control over DNS may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.
Lukasz Wojtow reported that the software does not validate the length of user-supplied input (supplied by a DNS server) to determine if the host address will fit within the 'sock_addr.sin_addr' buffer when a reverse DNS lookup is performed.  A remote user with control over the DNS or the ability to spoof the DNS may be able to supply a specially crafted return value to trigger the buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix) MySQL Access Control Error in Databases With Underscore Wildcard Character May Grant Unauthorized Access
Description:
An access control vulnerability was reported in MySQL.  A remote authenticated user can gain unauthorized privileges on a database.
Sergei Golubchik reported that a remote authenticated user can gain privileges on a database if the user is granted privileges on a similarly named database that contains an underscore in the database name.  For example, a user with privileges on 'some_db' can gain privileges on 'some1db', 'some2db', and similarly named databases.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain unauthorized privileges on an arbitrary database.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: (Trustix Issues Fix) MySQL May Let Remote Authenticated Users Access Restricted Tables or Crash the System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in MySQL.  A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.  A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
In March 2004, Oleksandr Byelkin reported that an 'alter table [...] rename [...]' command will check the create/insert rights of the old table instead of the new table [CVE: CVE-2004-0835].  As a result, a user may be able to gain access to tables that the user is not authorized to access.

In January 2004, Dean Ellis reported that if multiple threads issue 'alter' commands against 'merge' tables to modify the 'union', the target server may crash [CVE: CVE-2004-0837].

The original bug reports are available at:

http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=3270
http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=2408
Impact':
A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.

A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Trustix has issued a fix, available at:

http://http.trustix.org/pub/trustix/updates/
ftp://ftp.trustix.org/pub/trustix/updates/

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) MySQL Buffer Overflow in mysql_real_connect() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysql_real_connect().  A remote user with control over DNS may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.
Lukasz Wojtow reported that the software does not validate the length of user-supplied input (supplied by a DNS server) to determine if the host address will fit within the 'sock_addr.sin_addr' buffer when a reverse DNS lookup is performed.  A remote user with control over the DNS or the ability to spoof the DNS may be able to supply a specially crafted return value to trigger the buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Debian has released a fix.

Title: MySQL May Let Remote Authenticated Users Access Restricted Tables or Crash the System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in MySQL.  A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.  A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
In March 2004, Oleksandr Byelkin reported that an 'alter table [...] rename [...]' command will check the create/insert rights of the old table instead of the new table [CVE: CVE-2004-0835].  As a result, a user may be able to gain access to tables that the user is not authorized to access.

In January 2004, Dean Ellis reported that if multiple threads issue 'alter' commands against 'merge' tables to modify the 'union', the target server may crash [CVE: CVE-2004-0837].

The original bug reports are available at:

http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=3270
http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=2408
Impact':
A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.

A remote authenticated user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available via the source tree. Information about accessing the source trees is available at:

http://www.mysql.com/doc/en/Installing_source_tree.html

Title: IBM DB2 Has Numerous Buffer Overflows May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in IBM's DB2 Universal Database. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
NGSSoftware reported 20 vulnerabilities in the IBM DB2 software, most of which are buffer overflows that can be exploited by a remote user.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

NGSSoftware has provided additional details in eight separate advisories, available at:

http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005A.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005B.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005C.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005D.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005E.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005F.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005G.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005H.txt
http://www.ngssoftware.com/advisories/db205012005I.txt

[Editor's note:  This alert will be updated shortly to include the details provided by NGS Software.]
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued Fixpak 6a and 7a for DB2 v8.1, available at:

http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2/udb/support/downloadv8.html

Fixpaks for DB2 v7.x are available at:

http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2/udb/support/downloadv7.html

Title: Microsoft SQL Server Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Sending a Specially Crafted Large Buffer
Description:
securma massine reported a denial of service vulnerability in Microsoft SQL Server 7.0.  A remote user can cause the target database service to crash.
It is reported that a remote user can supply a large buffer with specially crafted data to cause the 'mssqlserver' service to crash.

A 700000 byte buffer consisting of the following character string repeated can trigger the flaw:

\x10\x00\x00\x10\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc\xcc
Impact': A remote user can cause the database service to stop.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: MySQL libmysqlclient Buffer Overflow in Executing Prepared Statements Has Unspecified Impact
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in libmysqlclient.  A remote authenticated user can trigger a buffer overflow.  The impact was not specified.
Ken Gieselman reported that a remote authenticated user can execute bulk inserts using prepared statements containing thousands of placeholders to trigger a buffer overflow.

The original bug report is available at:

http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=5194
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed development version (4.1.5), available at:

http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/4.1.html

Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlhotcopy' Unsafe Temporary Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysqlhotcopy.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
The vendor reported that mysqlhotcopy creates temporary files in '/tmp' using predictable file names.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to a predicted temporary filename.  Then, when mysqlhotcopy is run, the symlinked file may be overwritten.

Jeroen van Wolffelaar is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
Gentoo has issued a fix and indicates that all MySQL users should upgrade to the latest version:

    # emerge sync

    # emerge -pv ">=dev-db/mysql-4.0.20-r1"
    # emerge ">=dev-db/mysql-4.0.20-r1"

Title: IBM DB2 Buffer Overflows May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Some buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in IBM's DB2 Universal Database.  A reomte user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
NGSSoftware reported that DB2 contains two buffer overflows that can be exploited by a remote user.  No further details were provided.

NGSSoftware plans to publish details in December 2004.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Fixpak 7 for DB2 8.1, Fixpak 12 for DB2 7.x), available at:

http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2/udb/support/downloadv8.html
http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2/udb/support/downloadv7.html

Title: Oracle Database Server Has Multiple Flaws That Let Remote Users Take Control of the Server
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported Oracle's Database Server.  A remote user can obtain control of the database server.
Numerous buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported by several different security researchers.

In July 2004, NGSSoftware reported 34 vulnerabilities in Oracle's Database Server and Application Server products, most of which are considered critical.  The vulnerabilities include buffer overflows, PL/SQL injection, trigger abuse, character set conversion errors, and denial of service bugs.  Specific details have not been published.  However, NGSSoftware plans to issue details by December 2004.

In August 2004, Application Security, Inc. separately reported 44 buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the Oracle Database Server.  Cesar Cerrudo and Esteban Martinez Fayo are credited with discovering these overflows.  A list of the affected packages and parameters is provided in their advisory, available at:

http://www.appsecinc.com/resources/alerts/oracle/2004-0001/

In September 2004, iDEFENSE reported two vulnerabilities.  A remote authenticated user with execute permissions can invoke the 'ctxsys.driload' package to execute database commands with administrative privileges [CVE: CVE-2004-0637].  A remote authenticated user can trigger a buffer overflow in the dbms_system.ksdwrt() function to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE: CVE-2004-0638].  Users with SYS or SYSTEM roles or with execute permissions on the dbms_system package can exploit this flaw.  The vendor was notified on May 6, 2004.

The iDEFENSE advisories are available at:

http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=135&type=vulnerabilities
http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=136&type=vulnerabilities

With the vulnerabilities reported by NGSSoftware, AppSecInc, and iDEFENSE, a remote user can gain control of the database server.  A local user can gain control of the database server.
Impact': A remote user or a local user can gain control of the database server.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix.  Patch information is provided in MetaLink Document ID 281189.1, available at:

http://metalink.oracle.com/metalink/plsql/ml2_documents.showDocument?p_database_id=NOT&p_id=281189.1

A fix is available in Oracle Database 10g Release 1, version 10.1.0.3.

Title: Oracle Enterprise Manager Has Local Vulnerabilities With Unspecified Impact
Description:
Some vulnerabilities were reported in Oracle Enterprise Manager.  A local user can exploit these flaws.  The impact was not specified.
The vendor reported that the Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control and Oracle Enterprise Manager Database Control products contain several vulnerabilities.  Oracle characterizes the exposure risk as high.

A local user on the Enterprise Manager host can exploit these flaws.

No details were provided.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution:
Oracle has issued a fix.  Patch information is provided in MetaLink Document ID 281189.1, available at:

http://metalink.oracle.com/metalink/plsql/ml2_documents.showDocument?p_database_id=NOT&p_id=281189.1

A fix will be included as part of the future 10.1.0.3 release.

Title: IBM DB2 Assigns World-Writeable Permissions to Database Managed Space (DMS) Directories
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM's DB2 database.  A local user can modify files in the Database Managed Space (DMS) directories.
In December 2003, IBM reported that DB2 creates DMS directories with world-writeable permissions (mode 777).  A local user can modify or delete files in those directories.
Impact': A local user can modify or delete files in the DMS directories.
Solution:
A fix is available as part of DB2 Universal Database Version 7 FixPak 12 at:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=0&uid=swg24007062

The following Version 8 fixes are available:

Version 8 FixPak 5:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=0&uid=swg24006465

Version 8 FixPak 4a:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=0&uid=swg24006358

Version 8 FixPak 6:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?rs=0&uid=swg24007489

Title: PostgreSQL on Debian Linux Discloses Log Files to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PostgreSQL as distribution on Debian GNU/Linux.  A local user can view the log files, which may contain password information.
Harhalakis Stefanos reported that the default permissions allow local users to read the log files.  If a user has attempted to authenticate to the database with an incorrect username but correct password, the log file will contain the password.  A local user can read the log file to obtain username and password information for failed database login attempts.
Impact': A local user can read the log files, which may contain usernames and passwords.
Solution:
A preliminary patch is available at:

http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=266878

The preliminary patch is:

393c393
< install -d "$LOGDIR"
---
> install -m 0750 -d "$LOGDIR"
396a397
> chmod 0750 "$LOGFILE"

Title: MySQL Buffer Overflow in mysql_real_connect() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysql_real_connect().  A remote user with control over DNS may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.
Lukasz Wojtow reported that the software does not validate the length of user-supplied input (supplied by a DNS server) to determine if the host address will fit within the 'sock_addr.sin_addr' buffer when a reverse DNS lookup is performed.  A remote user with control over the DNS or the ability to spoof the DNS may be able to supply a specially crafted return value to trigger the buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available via the source tree.  Information about accessing the source trees is available at:

http://www.mysql.com/doc/en/Installing_source_tree.html

The fix will be included in the next release.

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlhotcopy' Unsafe Temporary Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysqlhotcopy.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
The vendor reported that mysqlhotcopy creates temporary files in '/tmp' using predictable file names.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to a predicted temporary filename.  Then, when mysqlhotcopy is run, the symlinked file may be overwritten.

Jeroen van Wolffelaar is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
Debian has issued a fix for the stable distribution (woody) in version 3.23.49-8.7 of mysql and for the unstable distribution (sid) in version 4.0.20-11 of mysql-dfsg.

Title: MySQL 'mysqlhotcopy' Unsafe Temporary Files May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in mysqlhotcopy.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
The vendor reported that mysqlhotcopy creates temporary files in '/tmp' using predictable file names.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to a predicted temporary filename.  Then, when mysqlhotcopy is run, the symlinked file may be overwritten.

Jeroen van Wolffelaar is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
A fix (1.43/scripts/mysqlhotcopy.sh) is available via CVS.  Information on how to access the MySQL CVS is available at:

http://www.mysql.com/doc/I/n/Installing_source_tree.html

Title: (Mandrake Issues Fix) odbc-postgresql Buffer Overflow in make_string() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in odbc-postgresql.  A remote user can cause the target service to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
'delman' reported that a remote user can supply a specially crafted and large input to cause odbc-postgresql to crash.

The flaw reportedly resides in 'misc.c' in the make_string() function.

The report indicates that it may be possible to execute arbitrary code on the target system, but that was not confirmed.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service (Apache) to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
Solution:
Mandrake has issued a fix.

Title: MySQL check_scramble_323() Zero-Length Comparison Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A buffer overflow and authentication bypass vulnerability was reported in MySQL.  A remote user can authenticate to the database server without a password.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code in some cases.
Chris Anley of NGSSoftware reported that a remote user can submit a specially crafted authentication packet to bypass the password authentication mechanims on MySQL.  The flaw reportedly resides in the check_scramble_323() function [CVE: CVE-2004-0627].

A remote user can specify an arbitrary 'passwd_len' value to cause the function to compare a known 'scrambled' password value with a zero-length string.  The function reportedly allows a remote user to authenticate successfully with a zero-length string.

It is also reported that there is a stack-based buffer overflow that can be triggered by a long 'scramble' string generated by my_rnd() [CVE: CVE-2004-0628].  On some platforms, arbitrary code execution is possible, according to the report.

The vendor was reportedly notified on June 1, 2004.

A paper describing MySQL protection techniques is available at:

http://www.ngssoftware.com/papers/HackproofingMySQL.pdf
Impact':
A remote user can authenticate to the target database.

A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has released a fix in version 4.1.3 and in the most recent builds of version 5.0.

Title: IBM Informix I-Spy 'runbin' Lets Local Users Grab Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM's Informix I-Spy.  A local user can gain elevated privileges.
IBM reported that the runbin executable in the $ISPY_DIR/bin directory has set userid (setuid) 'root' permissions.  A local user may be able to gain root access on the system.

IBM has assigned product issue 168233 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can gain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
IBM reportedly plans to issue a fix in versions 2.00.UD3 and 2.00.FD3, scheduled for August 2004.

As a workaround, the IBM advisory references the following script to remove setuid permissions from the runbin file:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21172742&aid=1

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) odbc-postgresql Buffer Overflow in make_string() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in odbc-postgresql.  A remote user can cause the target service to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
'delman' reported that a remote user can supply a specially crafted and large input to cause odbc-postgresql to crash.

The flaw reportedly resides in 'misc.c' in the make_string() function.

The report indicates that it may be possible to execute arbitrary code on the target system, but that was not confirmed.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service (Apache) to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
Solution: Debian has released a fix for the stable distribution (woody) in version 7.2.1-2woody5 and for the unstable distribution (sid) in version 07.03.0200-3.

Title: odbc-postgresql Buffer Overflow in make_string() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in odbc-postgresql.  A remote user can cause the target service to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
'delman' reported that a remote user can supply a specially crafted and large input to cause odbc-postgresql to crash.

The flaw reportedly resides in 'misc.c' in the make_string() function.

The report indicates that it may be possible to execute arbitrary code on the target system, but that was not confirmed.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service (Apache) to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: InterBase Buffer Overflow in Processing Database Name Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Borland InterBase database in the processing of database names. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
KF reported that a remote user can connect to the database and send a specially crafted database name to execute arbitrary code.

A demonstration exploit command is provided:

./gsec -database 127.0.0.1:`perl -e'print ("A"x300)'`

The same type of vulnerability was previously reported in Firebird by Noam Rathaus of SecuriTeam.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Firebird Database Can Be Crashed By Remote Users With Specially Crafted Database Name
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Firebird database in the processing of database names.  A remote user can cause the target server to crash.
SecuriTeam reported that a remote user can connect to the database and send a specially crafted database name to cause the target database service to crash.

A demonstration exploit is provided:

gsec -database 192.168.1.52:`perl -e'print ("A"x300)'` -user whenever -password whatever

Noam Rathaus of SecuriTeam is credited with discovering this flaw.
Impact': A remote user can cause the database service to crash.
Solution: The report indicates that version 1.5.0 is not vulnerable.

Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqld_multi' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the MySQL 'mysqld_multi' script.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
SuSE reported that the 'mysqld_multi' shell script creates a temporary log file ('/tmp/mysqld_multi.log') in an unsafe manner. A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file. Then, when the script is run by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user. A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Gentoo has released a fix and recommends that all users upgrade to the latest stable version of MySQL.

    # emerge sync

    # emerge -pv ">=dev-db/mysql-4.0.18-r2"
    # emerge ">=dev-db/mysql-4.0.18-r2"

Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlbug' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the 'mysqlbug' component.  A local user can overwrite files on the target system.
Shaun Colley reported that when a user runs 'mysqlbug' and then exits the text editor without modifying the bug report, a temporary file ('/tmp/failed-mysql-bugreport') is created in an unsafe manner.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file.  Then, when the error condition is triggered by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Gentoo has released a fix and recommends that all users upgrade to the latest stable version of MySQL.

    # emerge sync

    # emerge -pv ">=dev-db/mysql-4.0.18-r2"
    # emerge ">=dev-db/mysql-4.0.18-r2"

Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) Firebird Database Buffer Overflows Let Local Users Gain Elevated or Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in the Firebird database.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges, potentially including root privileges.
Dtors Security Research reported that the gds_inet_server, gds_drop, and gds_lock_mgr applications do not perform proper bounds checking on variables returned by the getenv() function.  A local user can set the INTERBASE environment variable to a specially crafted value to trigger the overflow and execute arbitrary code.  

On FreeBSD, the software is installed by default with set user id (setuid) 'firebird' user privileges, so the code will run with the privileges of the database user account, according to the report.  On Linux, the software is reportedly installed with setuid 'root' user privileges, allowing the code to run with root privileges.

On FreeBSD, once the local user has 'firebird' user privileges, the local user can modify the database binaries to include trojan code.  Then, when a target user on the system executes the database, the local user can gain the privileges of that target user (including those of root users).

Some demonstration exploit code is provided in the Source Message.
Impact':
A local user can execute arbitrary code with 'firebird' user privileges or 'root' user privileges, depending on the installation.

With 'firebird' user privileges, the local user can modify the database application to obtain elevated privileges when a target user runs the database.
Solution:
Gentoo has released a fix and indicates that all users should upgrade to the latest version of Firebird:

    # emerge sync

    # emerge -pv ">=dev-db/firebird-1.5"
    # emerge ">=dev-db/firebird-1.5"

Title: (Vendor Issues Fix) PrimeBase SQL Database Server Discloses Database Passwords to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the PrimeBase SQL Database Server.  A local user can view the database admin password.
Vapid Labs reported that the database server stores the admin password in clear text in the 'password.adm' file in the server folder.

The report stated that because of typical default umask settings, any local user may be able to view the password on typical system installations.

It is also reported that the software is configured with a default "Administrator" account that requires no password (although the documentation recommends that the user set the password during installation).
Impact': A local user can view the database admin password.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued a fix, available at:

http://www.Primebase.com/ftp/releases/4229/

Solution:

Then, when the error condition is triggered by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqlbug' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the 'mysqlbug' component.  A local user can overwrite files on the target system.
Shaun Colley reported that when a user runs 'mysqlbug' and then exits the text editor without modifying the bug report, a temporary file ('/tmp/failed-mysql-bugreport') is created in an unsafe manner.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file.  Then, when the error condition is triggered by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Debian has released a fix for the stable distribution (woody) in version 3.23.49-8.6.

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) MySQL 'mysqld_multi' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the MySQL 'mysqld_multi' script.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
SuSE reported that the 'mysqld_multi' shell script creates a temporary log file ('/tmp/mysqld_multi.log') in an unsafe manner. A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file. Then, when the script is run by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user. A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Debian has released a fix for the stable distribution (woody) in version 3.23.49-8.6.

Title: MySQL 'mysqld_multi' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the MySQL 'mysqld_multi' script.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
SuSE reported that the 'mysqld_multi' shell script creates a temporary log file ('/tmp/mysqld_multi.log') in an unsafe manner. A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file. Then, when the script is run by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user. A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version, which has been committed to the MySQL source repository, available at:

http://www.mysql.com/doc/en/Installing_source_tree.html

The fix is included in version 1.13 of 'scripts/mysqld_multi.sh' as of April 14, 2004.

Title: Microsoft Jet Database Engine 'msjet40.dll' Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Jet Database Engine.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can reportedly create a specially crafted database query and send it via an application that is using Jet to trigger the buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with the privilege of the target application or service.  This may include SYSTEM level privileges.

If the system contains 'Msjet40.dll', a security update is reportedly required.

Microsoft has assigned a 'Moderate' severity rating for Windows NT 4.0 and an 'Important' severity rating for Windows 2000, XP, and 2003.  A rating of 'Not Critical' applies to Windows 98/98SE/Me.

Microsoft credits Matt Thompson of Aberdeen IT with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the affected application or service, which may include SYSTEM level privileges.
Solution:
Microsoft has issued the following fixes.

Microsoft Windows NT  Workstation 4.0 Service Pack 6a:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=7678462A-52EC-48D5-9AEB-46EC4CC053C7&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows NT Server 4.0 Service Pack 6a:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=7678462A-52EC-48D5-9AEB-46EC4CC053C7&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows NT Server 4.0 Terminal Server Edition Service Pack 6:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=7678462A-52EC-48D5-9AEB-46EC4CC053C7&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows 2000 Service Pack 2, Microsoft Windows 2000 Service Pack 3, and 
Microsoft Windows 2000 Service Pack 4:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=5813346A-7EC2-4F57-A199-8375DA0AD816&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows XP and Microsoft Windows XP Service Pack 1:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=EA17D1CB-075E-4B63-BC45-06EBBF41C6B5&displaylang=en

 Microsoft Windows XP 64-Bit Edition Service Pack 1:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=B487610D-806C-4289-BE70-92F7D2337E17&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows XP 64-Bit Edition Version 2003:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=E4E0EB80-7395-4C07-BC1D-B187DE541BC2&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows Server  2003:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=216D708B-3A55-4B50-8AD2-BFF06B668CBB&displaylang=en

Microsoft Windows Server 2003 64-Bit Edition:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=E4E0EB80-7395-4C07-BC1D-B187DE541BC2&displaylang=en


For Microsoft Windows 98, Microsoft Windows 98 Second Edition (SE), and Microsoft Windows Millennium Edition (ME), Microsoft recommends that you read the FAQ section of their security bulletin for details about these operating systems.

Title: MySQL 'mysqlbug' Temporary File Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the 'mysqlbug' component.  A local user can overwrite files on the target system.
Shaun Colley reported that when a user runs 'mysqlbug' and then exits the text editor without modifying the bug report, a temporary file ('/tmp/failed-mysql-bugreport') is created in an unsafe manner.  A local user can create a symbolic link (symlink) from a critical file on the system to this temporary file.  Then, when the error condition is triggered by a target user, the symlinked file will be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.

A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Impact': A local user can cause files to be overwritten with the privileges of the target user.  A local user may be able to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version, which has been committed to the MySQL source repository, available at:

http://www.mysql.com/doc/en/Installing_source_tree.html

The fixed version will reportedly be included in the next full release of MySQL.

Title: Borland Interbase Unsafe Permissions on 'admin.ib' Let Local Users Gain Database Administrative Privileges
Description:
iDEFENSE reported a vulnerability in Borland's Interbase database.  A local user can gain database administrator privileges.
It is reported that the 'admin.ib' user database file is installed with world-writable permissions.  A local user can reportedly add or modify database accounts.

Larry Cashdollar is credited with discovering this flaw.

The vendor was reportedly notified on February 9, 2004 and March 1, 2004 without response.
Impact': A local user can gain database administrator privileges.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The report indicates that, as a workaround, you can remove the global write permissions from the affected 'admin.ib' file.

Title: IBM DB2 'db2rcmd.exe' Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Commands With Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM's DB2 database software in the 'db2rcmd.exe' process.  A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
NGSSoftware reported that a remote authenticated user can send a command via a named pipe (DB2REMOTECMD) to execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the 'db2admin' account.  A remote authenticated user (including users with only 'Guest' account privileges) can gain database administrator privileges on the target system.
Impact': A remote authenticated user (authenticated to Windows) can execute arbitrary commands on the database with 'db2admin' privileges.
Solution:
IBM has issued a fix in Fixpak 5, available at:

http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2/udb/support/downloadv8.html

Title: Oracle9i Database Server XML SOAP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Oracle9i Database Server in the processing of Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) messages with specially crafted XML data type definitions (DTDs).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
No further details were provided.

Oracle credits Amit Klein of Sanctum Inc. with reporting this flaw.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor reports that you can disable SOAP as a workaround by removing or renaming the following SOAP library:

   [Oracle Home]/soap/lib/soap.jar

For patch information, see Metalink Document ID 259556.1:

http://metalink.oracle.com/metalink/plsql/ml2_documents.showDocument?p_database_id=NOT&p_id=259556.1

Title: Oracle Database Server Lets Remote Authenticated Users Hijack User Sessions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Oracle9i Database Server Release 1 and 2.  A remote authenticated user can hijack a user session or deny service to users.
It is reported that a remote authenticated user (with privileges to invoke SQL queries, which is the default setting) can cause denial of service conditions against an active user session or may be able to capture an active user session.

No further details were provided.

Oracle credits David Litchfield of Next Generation Security Software Ltd. with reporting this flaw.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can deny service to existing user sessions.  A remote authenticated user can capture user sessions.
Solution:
For patch information, see MetaLink Document ID 258254.1:

http://metalink.oracle.com/metalink/plsql/ml2_documents.showDocument?p_database_id=NOT&p_id=258254.1

Title: Oracle Lite Mobile Server Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access the Oracle Database Server
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Oracle 9i Lite Mobile Server (part of Oracle9i Lite).  A remote authenticated user can gain access to a connected Oracle database server.
It is reported that a remote authenticated user on Oracle9i Lite Mobile Server may be able to gain unauthorized access to a connected Oracle database server by executing SQL commands.  No further information was provided.

Oracle credits Alexander Kornbrust with reporting this flaw.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain access to a connected database.
Solution:
For patch information, see MetaLink Document ID 261992.1:

http://metalink.oracle.com/metalink/plsql/ml2_documents.showDocument?p_database_id=NOT&p_id=261992.1

Oracle does not plan to release a patch set for Oracle9i Lite Version 5.0.0.0.0 or Oracle9i Lite Version 5.0.1.0.0.  The patch can only be applied to version 5.0.2.0.0.

Title: IBM Cloudscape Default Configuration Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands to Execute Arbitrary Binaries
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IBM Cloudscape.  A remote user can inject commands to cause arbitrary executables on the target system to be executed.
Illegalaccess.org reported that that a remote user can send a specially crafted SQL statement to trigger the flaw.  The vulnerability is reportedly due to inadequate security settings and library bugs in the sun.* and org.apache.* packages in jdk 1.4.2_03 when Cloudscape is run without an appropriately configured security manager.

The vendor was reportedly notified on November 15, 2003.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary binaries to be executed on the target system, deny service on the target system, and obtain information from the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: IBM Informix Dynamic Server Buffer Overflows and Format String Flaws Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in IBM's Informix Dynamic Server.  A local user can obtain elevated privileges.
Vulnerabilities were reported by Secure Network Operations Strategic Reconnaissance Team and also by Juan Manuel Pascual Escriba in several binaries included with the Informix Dynamic Server, including:

oninit, onmode, onedcu, ifmxgcore, ontape, ondblog, onbar_d, onsmsync, onmonitor, sgidsh, mkdbsdir, onshowaudit, onaudit, onspaces, onparams, onlog, oncheck, onpload, onstat, onedpu, onload, onunload, and xtree.

A local user can reportedly set the GL_PATH environment variable to a specially crafted value to trigger a buffer overflow in several of these components.

A local user can also reportedly set the ONCONFIG environment variable to a value larger than 495 bytes to cause 'ontape' to execute arbitrary code.

A local user can also trigger a format string flaw in some of the components.  The local user can replace a message file that is required by the target component so that when executed, the information in the malicious message file will cause arbitrary code to run on the target system.

In all sets of vulnerabilities, arbitrary code can be executed with informix group privileges or root user privileges, depending on the specific component.
Impact': A local user may be able to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges, including 'informix' group privileges and 'root' user privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has released the following patches (IDS 9.40.UC3, 9.30.UC7, and 7.31.UD7).  For more information, see:

http://www-1.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21153336

Title: PointBase Database Lack of Policy File Permits Remote Users to Crash the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the PointBase database.  A remote user can crash the target system that is running the database.
It is reported that the default PointBase installation does not include an appropriate security manager.  As a result, all jar files are granted all permissions.  A remote user can submit malicious PointBase application commands to crash the underlying Java virtual machine.  It may also be possible to view information or inject remote commands, the report said.

Some demonstration exploit code is provided in the Source Message.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system running PointBase to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Sybase Adaptive Server Anywhere Has Multiple Flaws That Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Sybase Adaptive Server Anywhere, part of SQL Anywhere Studio.
NGSSoftware reported many buffer overflows and a format string flaw in components of the database.

It is reported that a remote authenticated user can exploit a format string vulnerability in the XP_SPRINTF extended stored procedure to execute arbitrary code with 'dba' user privileges.

It is also reported that many CREATE statements contain buffer overflows.  A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code with 'dba' user privileges.  Those statements include:  DATABASE, [COMPRESSED | EXPANDED] DATABASE, ENCRYPTED FILE, DECRYPT FILE, DBSPACE, and WRITE FILE.

Buffer overflows were also reported in the following ALTER statements:  DATABASE, and WRITEFILE.

Buffer overflows were also reported in the following BACKUP statements: DATABASE DIRECTORY, and DATABASE TO

The following statements reportedly also contain buffer overflows:  INSTALL JAVA, DROP DATABSE, RESTORE DATABASE, and START DATABSE.

The following procedures and stored procedures reportedly contain buffer overflows:  XP_STARTSMTP, XP_SENDMAIL, SP_REMOTE_COLUMNS, SP_REMOTE_EXPORTED_KEYS, SP_REMOTE_IMPORTED_KEYS, SP_REMOTE_PRIMARY_KEYS, SP_REMOTE_TABLES, SA_FORWARD_TO, and SA_EXEC_SCRIPT.

A number of functions were found to allow a remote authenticated user to cause denial of service conditions on the target server.

The vendor was reportedly notified in November 2003.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code with 'dba' user privileges.

A remote authenticated user can also cause denial of service conditions on the target server.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for SQL Anywhere 9.0.0 build 1250, available at:

http://downloads.sybase.com/swd/swx/sdsummary.stm?baseprodName=SQL+Anywhere+Studio&baseprod=144&client=swx&previewObj=4&timeframeObj=6
Underlying OS Comments: Tested on Windows 2000 and XP; Not tested on Linux/UNIX based systems

Title: (Turbolinux Issues Fix) Re: PostgreSQL Buffer Overflow in pg_to_ascii() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code.
In July 2003, some buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL in the pg_to_ascii() function in 'ascii.c'.  A remote user may be able to connect to the database service and execute arbitrary code.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the postgresql service.
Solution:
Turbolinux has issued a fix.

Title: PrimeBase SQL Database Server Discloses Database Passwords to Local Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the PrimeBase SQL Database Server.  A local user can view the database admin password.
Vapid Labs reported that the database server stores the admin password in clear text in the 'password.adm' file in the server folder.

The report stated that because of typical default umask settings, any local user may be able to view the password on typical system installations.

It is also reported that the software is configured with a default "Administrator" account that requires no password (although the documentation recommends that the user set the password during installation).
Impact': A local user can view the database admin password.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The report recommends that you disable the Administrator account until a password has been set for it.

Title: Sybase Adaptive Server Enterprise (ASE) Can Be Crashed By Remote Authenticated Users Sending Invalid Password Arrays
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Sybase Adaptive Server Enterprise (ASE).  A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.
Rapid7 reported that a remote authenticated user (with a valid and correct user ID and password) can connect to the target server and supply an invalid password array to cause a child thread or process on the target server to crash.

The report indicates that on Windows-based systems, this will cause the server to stop responding to all commands, including new authentication requests.  On Linux-based systems, only the remote authenticated user's session will crash, the report said. However, a remote authenticated user can reportedly send a stream of connections to introduce denial of service conditions and prevent other clients from logging in.

It is reported that the remote authenticated user can specify invalid lengths for various components of the remote password array in the TDS LOGINREC structure to trigger a heap overflow.  The report indicates that the potential of remote code execution is unlikely but has not been ruled out.

It is reported that Sybase 11.0.3.3 for Linux appears to be unaffected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash (on Windows-based systems) or can cause resource-based denial of service conditions (on Linux-based systems).
Solution: The vendor has reportedly issued a fixed version (Sybase ASE 12.5 Electronic Software Distribution [ESD] #2).

Title: SAP DB web-tools Have Multiple Flaws That Disclose Files, Permit Remote Code Execution, and Grant Access to Remote Users
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the SAP DB web tools.  A remote user can view files on the system, execute arbitrary code on the system, and bypass authentication functions.
@stake reported multiple vulnerabilities in the SAP DB web-tools collection.

It is reported that the web-tools web server does not filter the '../' character strings from user-supplied GET requests (CVE: CVE-2003-0940).  A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to view files on the system with the privileges of the web server.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://127.0.0.1:85/../../../../../../boot.ini

According to the report, the web server runs with LocalSystem privileges on Windows-based systems.

It is also reported that a remote user with access to the web-tools can gain access to the Web Agent Administration pages without authenticating (CVE: CVE-2003-0941).  A remote user can request the following URL to access the pages:

http://127.0.0.1:85/waadmin.wa

It is also reported that there is a buffer overflow in the Web Agent Administration service (CVE: CVE-2003-0942).  A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to trigger the overflow.  On a Windows-based system, the remote user can gain SYSTEM level access.  A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://127.0.0.1:85/waadmin.wa?Service=Service&Name=AAAAAA....

It is also reported that the 'waecho' default service contains a buffer overflow in 'vwd83echo.c' that can be exploited in a similar fashion (CVE: CVE-2003-0944).  On a Windows-based system, the remote user can gain SYSTEM level access.  A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://127.0.0.1:85/waecho/AAAAAAA....

It is also reported that the Web Database Manager uses URL-based session IDs that are generated in a predictable manner (CVE: CVE-2003-0945).  A remote user can guess the session ID to gain access to the session.

Finally, it is reported that several services are enabled by default in the Web Agent (CVE: CVE-2003-0943).  The 'websql' and 'webdbm' allow a remote user to attempt to connect to databases that might not otherwise be accessible.

The vendor was reportedly initially notified in August 29, 2002.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.atstake.com/research/advisories/2003/a111703-2.txt
Impact':
A remote user can view files on the system with the privileges of the web server.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the system.

A remote user can gain access to the Web Agent Administration pages without authenticating.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (7.4.03.30), available at:

http://www.sapdb.org/7.4/sap_db_downloads.htm

Title: SAP DB 'niserver' Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Gain Root/LocalSystem Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the SAP database.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
@stake reported that there is a buffer overflow in the 'niserver' interface.  A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to the server on TCP port 7269 to trigger a buffer overflow in the eo420_GetStringFromVarPart() function in 'sys/src/eo/veo420.c'.

The code will run with root or LocalSystem privileges, the report said.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.atstake.com/research/advisories/2003/a111703-1.txt

The following notification timeline is provided:

03-Sep-2003: Vendor notified
07-Nov-2003: SAP releases fixed version 7.4.03.30
17-Nov-2003: Public notification
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root or LocalSystem privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (7.4.03.30), available at:

http://www.sapdb.org/7.4/sap_db_downloads.htm

Title: SAP DB NETAPI32.DLL Path Specification Flaw Lets Local Users Gain SYSTEM Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the SAP database.  A local user can gain elevated privileges on Windows-based systems.
@stake reported that on Windows-based systems, the code defines and uses the NET_API_DLL variable as 'NETAPI32.DLL' without specifying the required path.  A local user with write privileges in the current working directory of the SAP DB can create an alternate NETAPI32.DLL file containing malicious code.

According to the report, the SAP database will first look in the current working directory when attempting to load the affected DLL as part of the 'SQLAT' stored procedure and will, therefore, load and execute the malicious code.  The code will reportedly run with SYSTEM privileges.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.atstake.com/research/advisories/2003/a111703-1.txt

 The following notification timeline is provided:

03-Sep-2003: Vendor notified
07-Nov-2003: SAP releases fixed version 7.4.03.30
17-Nov-2003: Public notification
Impact': A local user with write privileges in the SAP DB current working directory can execute arbitrary code with SYSTEM privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (7.4.03.30), available at:

http://www.sapdb.org/7.4/sap_db_downloads.htm

Title: (Trustix Issues Fix) PostgreSQL Buffer Overflow in pg_to_ascii() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code.
In July 2003, some buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL in the pg_to_ascii() function in 'ascii.c'.  A remote user may be able to connect to the database service and execute arbitrary code.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the postgresql service.
Solution:
Trustix has released a fix, available at:

http://http.trustix.org/pub/trustix/updates/
ftp://ftp.trustix.org/pub/trustix/updates/

Users of the SWUP tool can update automatically using 'swup --upgrade'.

Title: IBM DB2 'db2start', 'db2stop', and 'db2govd' Flaws May Yield Root Privileges to Local Users
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several locally exploitable vulnerabilities were reported in IBM's DB2 database.  A local user can gain elevated privileges on the system, potentially including root privileges.
Secure Network Operations Strategic Reconnaissance Team reported that several binaries contain buffer overflows [CVE: CVE-2003-1050] and format string flaws [CVE: CVE-2003-1051].  A local user can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

The db2start, db2stop, and db2govd binaries are reportedly affected.  These applications have set user id (setuid) root or db2inst1 privileges and set group id (setgid) db2inst1 group privileges.
Impact': A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the system.
Solution:
IBM has issued Fixpak 4 for v8 and Fixpak 11 for v7, available at:

http://www.ibm.com/software/data/db2/udb/support/

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) PostgreSQL Buffer Overflow in pg_to_ascii() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code.
In July 2003, some buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL in the pg_to_ascii() function in 'ascii.c'.  A remote user may be able to connect to the database service and execute arbitrary code.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the postgresql service.
Solution:
Debian has released a fix in version 7.2.1-2woody4.

Title: PostgreSQL Buffer Overflow in pg_to_ascii() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code.
In July 2003, some buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in PostgreSQL in the pg_to_ascii() function in 'ascii.c'.  A remote user may be able to connect to the database service and execute arbitrary code.
Impact': A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the postgresql service.
Solution:
The fix has reportedly been added to release 7.2 and 7.3.4 back in July 2003.

A patch is also available at:

http://developer.postgresql.org/cvsweb.cgi/pgsql-server/src/backend/utils/adt/ascii.c

Title: MySQL  mysql_change_user() Double Free Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Crash mysqld
Description:
A buffer management vulnerability was reported in MySQL in versions prior to 3.23.55.  A remote authenticated user can cause the database server process to crash.
In January 2003, a double-free vulnerability was reported in mysqld.  A remote authenticated user can trigger a flaw in the mysql_change_user() function to cause the mysqld process to crash.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause mysqld to crash.
Solution:
The vendor released a fixed version (3.23.55), available at:

http://www.mysql.com/downloads/index.html

Title: (Vendor Describes Workaround) Re: Oracle Database Command Line Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the Oracle database.  A local user can execute arbitrary code to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
c0ntex reported that a local user can pass a large input string to the database to trigger a buffer overflow and overwrite the EIP register to execute arbitrary code.

It is reported that the 'oracle' and 'oracleO' binaries are affected.  Because the binaries are reportedly configured with set user id (setuid) 'oracle' user privileges, the arbitrary code will run with the privileges of the 'oracle' user.

The report indicates that Release 2 Patch Set 3 Ver 9.2.0.4.0 is vulnerable on Linux and AIX.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://packetstormsecurity.nl/0310-exploits/oracle_ownage.c

The vendor has reportedly been notified.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary code with 'oracle' user privileges.
Solution:
Oracle has described the following workaround of removing the "other" execute permissions from the affected binaries and making sure that only trusted users are in the same group as the affected binaries:

# cd $ORACLE_HOME/bin
# chmod o-x oracle oracleO

The vendor indicates that you should not remove the setuid or setgid permissions from the affected binaries.

Oracle reports that an interim patch will be available soon for Oracle 9i Database Release 9.2.0.4 for Linux x86.
Underlying OS Comments: Confirmed on Red Hat Linux and AIX

Title: Oracle Database Command Line Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in the Oracle database.  A local user can execute arbitrary code to gain elevated privileges on the target system.
c0ntex reported that a local user can pass a large input string to the database to trigger a buffer overflow and overwrite the EIP register to execute arbitrary code.

It is reported that the 'oracle' and 'oracleO' binaries are affected.  Because the binaries are reportedly configured with set user id (setuid) 'oracle' user privileges, the arbitrary code will run with the privileges of the 'oracle' user.

The report indicates that Release 2 Patch Set 3 Ver 9.2.0.4.0 is vulnerable on Linux and AIX.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://packetstormsecurity.nl/0310-exploits/oracle_ownage.c

The vendor has reportedly been notified.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary code with 'oracle' user privileges.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.
Underlying OS Comments: Confirmed on Red Hat Linux and AIX

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix for RH Enterprise Linux) MySQL acl_init() Buffer Overflow Permits Remote Authenticated Administrators to Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 4.0.14 and prior 4.0 versions; 3.0.57 and prior versions
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the processing of user passwords.  An authenticated administrator can execute arbitrary code on the system.
It is reported that a function that checks MySQL user passwords does not properly validate the length of a user-supplied password field.  An authenticated user with administrative privileges can set a "Password" field to a specially crafted value that is longer than 16 characters to trigger an overlow and execute arbitrary code.  The code will run with the privileges of the MySQL server process.

The report indicates that an administrator can invoke a function (such as 'FLUSH PRIVILEGES') to trigger an overflow in acl_init().  The exploit password length must be set to a multiple of 8.

A demonstration exploit example is provided in the Source Message.

According to the report, this has been confirmed on on OpenBSD 3.3-RELEASE, FreeBSD 4.8-STABLE, and Gentoo Linux 1.4.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrator can execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the MySQL process.
Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix for Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

Title: (SuSE Issues Fix) MySQL acl_init() Buffer Overflow Permits Remote Authenticated Administrators to Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): 4.0.14 and prior 4.0 versions; 3.0.57 and prior versions
Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was reported in MySQL in the processing of user passwords.  An authenticated administrator can execute arbitrary code on the system.
It is reported that a function that checks MySQL user passwords does not properly validate the length of a user-supplied password field.  An authenticated user with administrative privileges can set a "Password" field to a specially crafted value that is longer than 16 characters to trigger an overlow and execute arbitrary code.  The code will run with the privileges of the MySQL server process.

The report indicates that an administrator can invoke a function (such as 'FLUSH PRIVILEGES') to trigger an overflow in acl_init().  The exploit password length must be set to a multiple of 8.

A demonstration exploit example is provided in the Source Message.

According to the report, this has been confirmed on on OpenBSD 3.3-RELEASE, FreeBSD 4.8-STABLE, and Gentoo Linux 1.4.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrator can execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the MySQL process.
Solution:
SuSE has released a fix.

Title: IBM DB2 Buffer Overflow in LOAD and INVOKE Commands Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Some buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in IBM's DB2 database in the processing of the LOAD and INVOKE commands.  A remote authenticated user with certain privileges can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Pentest Limited reported that the 'LOAD' command contains a stack overflow (CVE: CVE-2003-0836).  A remote authenticated user with "Connect" privileges can reportedly send a specially crafted LOAD command to execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will typically run with Administrator privileges on Windows-based systems and with 'db2as' or 'db2inst1' privileges on Linux-based systems.

It is also reported that the 'INVOKE' command contains a buffer overflow (CVE: CVE-2003-0837).   A remote authenticated user with "Connect" privileges can reportedly send a specially crafted INVOKE command to execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with Administrator privileges.  Only version 7.x is affected and only Windows-based systems are affected, the report said.

The following notification timeline was provided:

- Pentest Notification: 20-11-2002
- Notification acknowledged by IBM: 22-11-2002
- Fixes available from: 17-09-2003
Impact': A remote authenticated user with "Connect" privileges can execute arbitrary code on the system.  The code will typically run with Administrator privileges (for affected Windows systems) or 'db2as' or 'db2inst1' (for affected Linux systems).
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for DB2 version 7.2 in Fixpak 10/10a for DB2 v7.2 and for DB2 version 8.1 in Fixpak 2 for DB2 v8.1.

The fixpaks are available at:

http://www-3.ibm.com/cgi-bin/db2www/data/db2/udb/winos2unix/support/download.d2w/report
Underlying OS Comments: The report indicates that only Windows and Linux systems were tested, but IBM indicates that other platforms may also be affected by the LOAD buffer overflow

Title: IBM DB2 Discovery Service Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the IBM DB2 "Discovery" service.  A remote user can cause the service to stop responding.
Application Security, Inc. reported that a remote user can send a UDP packet larger than 20 bytes to the discovery service on port 523 to cause the service to shut down.

The "DB2 - DB2DAS00" service must be restarted to return to normal operations.

CVE number CVE-2003-0827 has been assigned to this issue.
Impact': A remote user can cause the discovery service to shutdown.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (FixPak 10a), available at:

http://www-3.ibm.com/cgi-bin/db2www/data/db2/udb/winos2unix/support/download.d2w/report

Title: IBM DB2 db2licm and db2dart Buffer Overflows Let Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Several stack overflows were reported in IBM's DB2 database server.  A local user with certain privileges can obtain root privileges on the system.
Core Security Technologies reported that the db2licm and db2dart binaries contain buffer overflows.  A local user with certain privileges can supply a long command line argument to the applications to execute arbitrary code on the system.  Because the binaries are configured with set user id (setuid) root user privileges, the arbitrary code will execute with root privileges.

A local user with 'db2as' or 'db2inst1' user privileges can execute the binaries.

The report confirms that version 7.2 for Linux/x86 and for Linux/s390 is vulnerable.  Other versions and platforms may be affected, but were not tested.

Some demonstration exploit commands are provided:

/home/db2as/sqllib/adm/db2dart `perl -e 'print "A"x1287'`

/home/db2as/sqllib/adm/db2licm `perl -e 'print "A"x999'`

The vendor was reportedly notified on August 15, 2003 and acknowledged notification on August 18, 2003.
Impact': A local user with 'db2as' or 'db2inst1' user privileges can execute arbitrary code with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for the db2dart issue (CVE-2003-0758) in Fixpak 10 for DB2 v7.2, available at:

http://www-3.ibm.com/cgi-bin/db2www/data/db2/udb/winos2unix/support/download.d2w/report

The vendor has issued a fix for the db2licm issue (CVE-2003-0759) in Fixpak 10a for DB2 v7.2, to be available shortly at:

http://www-3.ibm.com/cgi-bin/db2www/data/db2/udb/winos2unix/support/v7fphist.d2w/report
